text: The or KNMKNM is an English acronym. KNM stands for "Kyoto National Museum". is one of the major art museums in Japan.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Museums" in Japan Encyclopedia, pp. 671-673. It is in Higashiyama Ward in Kyoto. The museum has art works and archaeological objects of Japan. In the collection, there is an emphasis on material from the Heian period through the Edo period when Kyoto was the capital of Japan.IAI National Institutes for Cultural Heritage. (2007). Outline, p. 2 [PDF/p. 5 of 44]. Retrieved 2012-2-7. The Museum is currently undergoing renovation and will reopen in 2013. ==History== KMN was established in 1889 as the Imperial Museum of Kyoto.Kyoto National Museum (KNM), Mandate and History . Retrieved 2012-2-7. Construction on the museum building finished in October 1895. The museum's first exhibition was opened in 1897. The museum went through a series of name changes. In 1900, it was called the Imperial Household Museum of Kyoto. In 1924, the museum was donated to the City of Kyoto in honor of the marriage of Crown Prince Hirohito. At that time, the name was changed to the Imperial Gift Museum of Kyoto.
